result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Donell Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on extended supervision on case 12cf174.  If defendant is revoked on case 12cf174, all costs, fees, assessments, and surcharges of this case can be taken from 25% of funds on deposit through collection by the Department of Corrections under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 91 days time served.
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry Donell Howard in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Larry Donell Howard in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 91 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 91 days time served.
TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, while on extended supervision on case 12cf174.  If defendant is revoked on case 12cf174, all costs, fees, assesments, and surcharges of this case can be taken from 25% of funds on deposit through collection by the Department of Corrections under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Defendant to make regular monthly payments.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Larry Donell Howard not in court, in custody.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/29/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Larry Donell Howard not in court, in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State to provide offer to defense.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 3/4/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Defendant Larry Donell Howard in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Larry Donell Howard in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
